title: Systems and Circuits Neuroscience
description: The course will cover a broad anatomical and functional description of interacting neural networks, or systems, in the brain responsible for sensory perception, internal state, and motor control. Course will discuss modern techniques and the use of model organisms for dissecting the anatomical and functional organization of the brain. Students will read current papers and are expected to participate in discussion of papers. Enrollment restricted to MS students in the following major code: BI84, BI87.
